title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Great experience. It was a panel of three interviewers. They each took turns got question and asked generic questions, about myself, personality, and scenarios. They also talked a lot about their benefits.
Interview Questions: An example of giving bad news to a customer.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Easy, 6 people in one interview. The first screening was with the HR manager over the phone. The second screening was with faculty and staff. Personal and situational questions. Ask about how to collaborate with outside vendors.
Interview Questions: Why the University of Utah? What do you think about diversity?

title: Student Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process may seem daunting, but it is quite the opposite. You first are interviewed by other members of the department and the second (and final) interview is with the director and the associate director.
Interview Questions: Give us an elevator pitch for this student program. A student comes in asking about our services, what do you say?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: no response after interview even after sending emails asking for the recruitment progression twice. The search committee is not patient during the interview and repeated remind me that they only have 20-30min
Interview Questions: routine questions you can find online.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Apply online and ask professor who you want to work for. Email your resume to the department manager to get the desired TA position. Apply to the positions before hand and don't wait for the last moment.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experience if any. Then they ask about the knowledge about particular subject. They look for people who knows about the subject.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone screening followed by a panel interview and technical assessment. Offer extended over email without any previous conversation about compensation. All was pretty easy and the technical assessment was only a w3 schools quiz/test
Interview Questions: They mostly covered resume and experiences

title: Director of Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (New York, NY) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was virtual which was very good. However, after four interviews, the company ghosted me. They told me they were going to now call my references and then I would have one more interview. I received an email shortly after saying they were a little behind and they would get back to me in a week. By four weeks later I assumed they were no longer interested. After all of that they could have at least had the decency to tell me I was no longer in the running.
Interview Questions: I was asked to develop a mock event.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Interview process began with a Screener with two staff members followed by second interview with larger group. Interview lasted 45 minutes with time for me to ask questions as well. Received offer the same day.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: Admissions Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2 step process. The first was getting to know you interview over the phone that lead into an in person interview which was done with a few members from their management team.
Interview Questions: Simple questions like why did I want to work there, what were my strengths, describe a time I had to navigate conflict with a co worker or client.

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: I had a multi-interview process which included a phone call with the search committee, a virtual meeting with the search committee and a virtual presentation to the entire department. All and all it was an inclusive and comprehensive process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? Tell me about a time when you had a conflict with a co-worker or friend.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: After completing the online application, there was a panel interview with 3-5 people. The process of the application, interview, and hiring took less than a month. There was a lot of helpful information given by the recruiter beforehand. The entire process was straightforward.
Interview Questions: - Tell me about yourself - What interests you about us - Difficult challenge and how you overcame it - Previous experience and how it can be used in the new role

title: Operarions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly quick and easy. I don’t think it was longer than 20 minutes. We talked about work life and expectations and then they offered me the job based on my previous work experience.
Interview Questions: How would you handle thing going wrong during one of your tasks?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Utah in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got a call and then a phone interview. They asked about why I wanted to apply for the school, a brief introduction and they introduced their departments briefly. They have asked me to share a work crisis I've dealt with and what I have learned from it.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you made a work mistake.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Online, oral interview via Zoom. Multiple faculty members of the review panel were involved in the interview. Questions were mostly subject-related. There are some tough question and some easy question.
Interview Questions: experience and the salary of  the job

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Great process. It was efficient and timely and they were very responsive. There were two rounds - first via zoom and the second in persons. Majority of questions, during both rounds, were behavioral based.
Interview Questions:
- Tell us about you and why this job? 
- Share how you manage conflicting priorities?

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Microsoft Teams interview with HR and supervisor. Each took turns asking questions.  Later another manager called with additional questions.  She gave me her phone number to call with additional questions
Interview Questions: Tell about a time you made a mistake

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Is easy and chill, nothing really going on you kinda just get the job as a student here. Just submit some information and meet the basic skill bar, and you would be good. Is a student-only job.
Interview Questions: There is not much a interview

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one in person the other online.  Was a very comfortable interviewing process.  Appreciated the up front approach of the interviewers. Was able to express my abilities as well as discuss the potential for growth within the company and where it can take a potential employee.
Interview Questions: How well can I prioritize needs of department.

title: Front Desk Person Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Was held over zoom but was professional and efficient. Done by two people, who both asked questions. Were honest about the expectations and clear when I would hear back. I did not have my answers already written, but the questions that were asked were generic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What do you look for in a supervisor?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: During the interview, I was asked to present my previous work first. Then we talk about the project I will be doing during my Ph.D. study, and the skills required for this project.
Interview Questions: What is your plan for your PhD study?

title: Administrative Asssistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received an email invitation to interview by phone Phone interview was followed by a zoom interview with the admin manager. Zoom interview with the admin manager was followed by a third peer interview on zoom as well. Withdrew from the process after the third interview.
Interview Questions: Describe how you prioritize many competing priorities?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Did not get an interview until I called. First interview was zoom, second was in person and like 8 hours long. Did not receive an answer until 6 weeks later.
Interview Questions: What makes you unique for this role?

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Received a phone call for scheduling an interview and met with a manager for an interview. They asks basic behavioral questions then ask you to solve some math problems from basic algebra to calculus.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation with a coworker?

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview  quick and multiple people. I had two interviews on the phone they. It was during the day  I don’t have any more word to describe this subject  but I can keep typing if you need
Interview Questions: Average questions, not hard but a little specific to their job.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty chill. The people conducting the interview were understanding and friendly to talk with. I got asked questions specific to the post of Academic advisor as to how you would react to some situations.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to a student given certain situations?

title: Marketing Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It took 1 hour and I interviewed three interviewers.  The overall atmosphere was calm and comfortable but most of the interview questions are quite critical and focused on the past projects that I've done.
Interview Questions: Based on your prior experiences, tell us about the project that you really liked and you don't like.

title: Program Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: A series of questions that are  delivered via email to which the recipient must respond by a specific deadline. They seem to often contact individuals who qualify directly to ask them to apply.
Interview Questions: Do you want to help peers in the program by using your experiences to inform others? How many students are you willing to mentor/how long? Would  you be willing to participate in events during afternoon hours in-person.

title: Recruiting Coordinator, Online MBA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had my first preliminary interview. It was a simple phone call and I was invited to come back for a Zoom interview to meet with the rest of the hiring team.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations at work?

title: Biostatistician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: First, a phone call from a recruiter/administrative assistant. Second, a phone interview with the biostatistics manager which included behavioral questions and technical questions, such as: Describe a 95% confidence interval. Describe a p-value to someone who is a non-statistician. A hypothetical linear regression model with a dummy variable for gender in which I was asked to calculate the coefficient for males. Ways to reduce a 95% confidence interval.  I had to take an additional statistical quiz (20-30 minutes) since I barely passed the technical parts of the phone interview. This quiz was mostly on basic SAS programming (less than, greater than...etc.). Third, a full day in-person interview with lunch where I spoke to all the faculty and several biostatisticians in the department. One faculty member had me go through several technical exercises/problems with him, the rest were more casual conversations.
Interview Questions: Describe a 95% confidence interval and p-value to a non-statistician.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was 30 minutes and focused on behavioral questions interested in my leadership and engagement style. This interview included quite a bit of information on the role, and what appeared to be minimal evaluation of the candidate.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Two on site meetings. One with group other with the leader.  Actually did away with position and did not fill it. Very nice people and very knowledgeable about their subjects.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress, team leadership questions, etc.

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly straight forward, we were give an online interview process where you record yourself answering 3 questions. You can redo it as many times as you like. Then I talked in person with the manager.
Interview Questions: Honestly I dont remember sorry

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: The interview was informal but detailed and lasted for most of the day, which was expected for the position I was applying for.  I did get to meet the entire research team, which was invaluable for making the decision to work there.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would solve an interpersonal problem

title: Data Entry Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Slow to start the interview process, I didn't hear anything for about a month after applying. I didn't get the job but everyone was nice. I've reapplied for another position since, am still waiting for a response.
Interview Questions: What is the best and worst part of working from home?

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Had one phone call, explained the position and what it entailed. Interviewer brought up pay and was much lower than expected. Did not receive 2nd interview and that was o k.
Interview Questions: Asked me about general experience

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Application on line, on site interview with two team members with influence on decision, One Zoom meeting, in person interview, phone interview with two more people. Each interview was one on one except the in person meeting.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself Why do you want this job? What are your goals?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Sent CV and letters of recommendation/Transcripts and all the required documents . Then I was informed I was on of the few chosen . Within a wek I was Interviewed on zoom by three Professors.
Interview Questions: On methodology based on my 30 years of experience teaching.

title: Facility Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Apply with resume and cover letter then interview with hiring team. The job requires you to have worked for the university for 2 semesters at least and you must be a supervisor or above.
Interview Questions: What is a way you would solve problems x, y, z

title: Radiation Safety Analyst I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews.  The first one was with the director.  It was the normal casual interview of getting to know me.  The second interview was a group interview and was intense.  They asked more questions on my knowledge in radiation and science.  Lasted 1 hour.  Intense but definitely worth it.
Interview Questions: What are the units of radiation?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed at a conference for a postdoctoral position at University of Utah. I has 2-3 meetings during the conference. I was asked about my work, what I want to do in future and some behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: About my PhD thesis work and some were about soft skills I have.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Fast, courteous, and professional and they were very kind in the whole process.  Did some of the only background checks I noticed. Panel interview, asked technical and managerial questions, and also asked about hobbies.
Interview Questions: How do you manage multiple priorities at once?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was really balanced, but stressful and long. I think the school should have less MMI questions and make the interview process a maximum of two hours. The whole thing required 5 hours.
Interview Questions: Ethical and behavioral questions in various circumstances

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Contact the Prof. who has open research positions.
Send your CV to the Prof.
Talk to the Prof. you will work with --- discuss your interest in the project and the abilities you have.
Interview Questions: Q: Why would you like to work on the Project?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: It was a friendly group interviewing me. Very welcoming and asked good questions relating to the work. They were professional and very well organized. The got back to me in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: What background I had in data management

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Introductory interview with one of the biostatisticians mainly simple questions about why I wanted to work there, some basic stats question. Then a follow up test with some simple stats questions agains very similar to the first phase except some more SAS questions.
Interview Questions: How would you create a frequency table in SAS

title: Director Interview

Both about an hour. Was final candidate, but budget issues caused the job to be removed and absorbed by another department. Very nice people and explained everything to me.

title: SQL Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Started with a 45 min Oracle SQL test.  I had used Postgres before and didn’t know some of the Oracle jargon. Then standard HR questions. The entire process was long.  It was weeks between each step.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: No interview, you just need to talk to the department and they will let you sign a contract if you are a graduate student. For enrolled into that , you will answer some questions about your research work...
Interview Questions: No interview

title: Customer Service Representative Interview

Interview Questions: How well do you work with others and how do you communicate with customers.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: I had a first round Phone interview after submitting my CV and research statement and was then invited to give a science talk at the university as well as meet one on one with a number of researchers and staff.

title: Business Analyst Interview

Interview Questions:
What kind of experiences do you have.

title: Media Production Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Nothing much I applied for a phd position and the professor took the skype interview.
He told me he would be wiiling to fund my phd after a week.  d

title: Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions:
The employer uses phone interviews to identify and recruit candidates for employment. Phone interviews are often used to narrow the pool of applicants who will be invited for in-person interviews.
The first in-person job interview is typically a one-on-one interview between the applicant and a hiring manager. The interviewer will ask questions about the applicant's experience and skills, work history, availability, and the qualifications the company is seeking in the optimal candidate for the job.
Interview Questions: what is your availability for work?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Reviewed and analyzed a data set involving healthcare data. Prompt was to determine which region the company should open new clinics and why. There were multiple questions to guide the thought process. Final interview involved walking through this case and explaining recommendations. Some fit questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your case slides. Why did you make the recommendation that you did? etc.

title: Data Warehouse Analyst Interview

It was mostly structured, with them reading questions from a paper. The technical portion was more free-form. The second interview was with higher management and seemed to be to check personality fit.

title: Computer Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: I applied online thru the University of Utah job website and the process took about 2 weeks. The interview type was 1:1 interview. After the interview, I heard back from them in 2-3 hours.
Interview Questions: what work environment are you most comfortable in

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (South Jordan, UT) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
It was a long process. I applied in October and was called to see if I was still interested in December, but it was only a week or two between steps following the first interview. 

They were really great to interview with- very thorough, made sure I knew what was expected for the position, asked if I had any concerns and were happy to answer any questions I had.  They definitely put me at ease and made me feel comfortable. You can tell they are all passionate about what they do and want to hire quality employees.
Interview Questions: How I prepared for the interview, what  I knew about the company, that particular clinic, etc.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. The first was with the two research managers and the second was a group interview.  Both interviews were straight forward and short. Not a challenging interview process.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions

title: Bio Statistician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume and cover letter, references, answered other descriptive questions. 1-hour interview one on one with hiring manager and had to complete timed statistical test to see stats abilities. Asked about previous experience, asked statistical questions, and described the job responsibilities and benefits.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest strengths?

title: Marketing Coorindator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 interviews over two months with multiple team members and in different settings. Very formal with group interviews and individual interviews. A tough interview process. Ended up getting the job but it was stressful and time consuming.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in Marketing? How would you handle a difficult client?

title: Software Design Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I'm very much aware of the delay that takes place in hiring at the University of Utah but this one was excruciatingly slow. I got called for an initial behavioral interview and then a take-home coding test and later a technical panel interview.  Well, I hate to say this but there is no clarity in the process and the team that I interviewed with, was the least professional outfit I have ever dealt with.  The letter that I received from the recruiter gave vague reasons about why I was not selected (after waiting for more than 3 months) and without informing me, they considered me for a position which I didn't even apply for (Software Design Engineer-Senior). 

I was asked basic-advanced questions related to Java and a lot of questions related to Threads in Java, SQL, and some Spring questions.

If you have got time to spare, apply at your own risk, and never wait for an outcome.
Interview Questions: Multithreading in Java.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: No phone interview, went straight to campus interview. The interview included a job talk and 5-6 individual meetings with faculty plus a very nice dinner with 2 faculty. I found everyone to be very warm and welcoming, enthusiastic about my work and very helpful in guiding me around during the interview.
Interview Questions: What kinds of research projects would you do here?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions:
Take GRE
Complete online application (free application which is really nice)
You may be invited for an interview (they pay for you to travel to SLC, UT, they put you up in a hotel, pay for all your food, and take you skiing (if you don't want to ski/snowboard, they have other activities you can participate in).
They inform you of their admission decision
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research

title: Reporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were scheduled over the phone or video chat. The final interview is in person. They fly out you and pay for lodging which is nice. They also give you a moment to meet with other reporters which is helpful to gain insight on what the newsroom is really like.
Interview Questions: They asked about past experience, reporting interests, investigative skills.

title: Administratoin Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone call, group call interview, simple questions, quite courteous, too bad no one ever followed up on the interview. Never expected this school would conduct an interview and leave an applicant just wondering what happened. Obviously, no job offer but a courtesy rejection email would at least allow applicants to move on. Leaving it to linger seems so contrary to the school mission and public facing statements about their hiring practices.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: They contacted me quickly and were very professional. They set a time and worked around my schedule so that we could meet. They were very friendly and open and honest regarding the position.
Interview Questions: Why I would be a good fit.

title: Ios Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got an e-mail back after a few weeks of my online resume submission for an in-person interview. Straightforward technical questions about data structures and algorithms were asked during the interview and I got the job the same day.
Interview Questions: How long have you been working with iOS?

title: Materials Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Professional interview in an outdated facility. Sat in a conference room with three other project managers. They took turns asking questions. It was average paced and comfortable. I do not recall all of the details of the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Producer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: No interview process. There was no interview or application process. Jobs are handed to students that the directors believe will be a good fit. One day I received an email regarding an open position and if I was interested. I replied that I was interested and the following week I began working.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Part Time Teller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: They would ask about your previous experiences, how can you relate to students from various backgrounds, and if you are willing to work for a full 12 months minimum in the position.
Interview Questions: The questions that starts with "What would you do if...?".

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: Applied through online and received call for an interview. Interviewers are nice and they will get you very comfortable but put yourself in a position that they must hire you.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Career Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview was conducted by manager and peer level career coach.  Questions were mostly behavior based, professional development, and career goals.  2nd interview was a presentation to the entire coaching team.
Interview Questions: What have you done for your own professional development in the last 6 months?

title: Fullstack Dev Bootcamp Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone screening to discuss my qualifications, asked some technical questions as well as some behavioral questions. Later, I met with the dean of the school under which this bootcamp was operating.
Interview Questions: What would your friends say about you?

title: Admisisons Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was full of very professional questions but with a fun, more relaxed environment. They really took the time to not only understand your work experience and how you would fit into the role but to learn about you as a person as well.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know how I saw myself fitting into the role?

title: HIM Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with all applicable supervisors and some staff with whom the position has interacts. While everybody was very friendly, the interview itself was very disorganized and haphazard.
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation where a manager was not easily available (i.e. after hours/weekend) and you did not readily know how to proceed in said situation?

title: Biostatistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: First interview: Phone call. For the first 40 minutes I was asked about different projects on my resume, and some questions with my work experience. Then I was asked a series of statistics questions to test my knowledge.
Interview Questions: What test would you use to determine if two categorical variables are independent?

title: Commuter Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was good, easy and comfortable I had to go into the office and I was interviewed by two people.  I got an offer for a job different than the one I originally applied for, but I took it and was promoted to the job I applied for a few months later.
Interview Questions: general character questions

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at the University of Utah for a Teaching Assistant position is very informal. Majority of the time you need to have previously taken the class that you would be working with. The exception to the rule is if you have taken multiple similar courses to the one that you would be assisting, or you’ve taken courses from the same teacher. Getting to know your teachers and program leaders is the best course of action for landing these jobs.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews with the professor whose research team I would be joining. No technical questions, just determining if I was a good fit.  Once the interviews were done, I was given a verbal offer over the phone.
Interview Questions: What previous lab experience have you had?

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first round was a phone interview. The second round was an hour-long interview with two sets of two interviewers who asked the same set of questions. After the second interview, I didn't hear back for almost three weeks, even with a follow-up. Two of the interviewers were friendly and receptive, but the other two were fairly difficult to get any feedback from.
Interview Questions: How did you solve a challenging leadership situation?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 interviews: one with members of the education team (other advisors) and the administrative manager, followed by an interview with the Division Chief and 2 Associate Chiefs.
Interview Questions: Tell how you prioritize tasks when there are many things to be accomplished.

title: Recruiting Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. One phone interview and two in person with a total of seven people. I've worked in HR for the past 4+ years so interviews aren't too foreign to me, but I think it was a pretty easy process. Nerve-racking waiting for the response though!
Interview Questions: Describe your current job duties?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Received a call after I submitted my resume. Met with two different people from the department and had an hour long interview. Received a call back on Monday and was hired by the end of the week.
Interview Questions: What does social media mean to you?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted TA application online and wait for notification. Then the professor to teach that class sent me an email for making an interview appointment. I had a face to face interview with him at professor's office.
Interview Questions: When would I graduate and what grade I got for the class.

title: Intellectual Property Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was easy and straightforward. Applied online, received a call and had a phone interview, and was subsequently asked to interview on site. Met with the tech transfer team, was given an exam to determine my attention to detail. Took roughly two hours on site.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work in IP?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was on the phone and was very opinionated.  I could tell I was just a 'number' to be supplied.  I found out later, they already had a person for the position.
Interview Questions: Asked about writing background, experience in years, and social network competence.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: meet 3 professors individually, talk ~ 30 minutes in their offices, talk about my own research experience , why I am interested in working with them, ask them questions about their research
Interview Questions: Mark asked me one question: Do you use vi or emacs?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was shortlisted for a phone screen after which i was asked to come down to the office in order to interview for the position. The in person interview was kinda similar, i was asked questions about based on my resume
Interview Questions: Etl concepts

title: Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I completed the job application online and then emailed the supervisor, whom I'd met about 18 months prior. I was called in for an interview that day. I was called back for a second interview the next day and accepted an offer about 3 days after that.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: The interview included all the basic background and experience questions. Primarily about my educational background and testing my medical knowledge.It was a telephonic and then other round had skype interview. Afterward, i got the offer letter,
Interview Questions: Why utah ?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Some behavior questions and technical questions. Some algorithms question like linear programming.  Which language do you prefer? It is not so hard, but you really need to prepare for this position. Take a look at some relevant materials. Since I am a part time graduate student research assistant, it would not so hard.
Interview Questions: Which language do you prefer?

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview and second interview in person.  The current supervisor and another coworker at the same level took turns asking questions the University Human Resources had prepared.  They did not ask follow up questions nor did they ask specific questions regarding my previous position at the University.
Interview Questions: What do you want to be when you grow up?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: U of U's invitation for an interview is a miracle. But if the miracle happen, there were three people asked me about ten questions. Questions were also in front of me on the table in a conference room. It took about 30 minutes. They were nice, I couldn't tell what they think during the interview. There is almost no chance to get the job. They usually already have their person for that position.
Interview Questions: They asked about multitasking, my hobby, situational questions like for example: 3 phones ring and boss need something important and somebody just came and want something at the same time - how would you handle it, or why they should hire me.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sat down with the floor manager and the clinical nurse coordinator in the managers small office. Positive people, with kind hearts, who don't seem to know much in general.
Interview Questions: What is your experience level.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my CV. After two weeks I got contacted by the professor. He asked me to meet with him and asked me some professional questions. And two weeks later, I received the offer.
Interview Questions: What is your future plan?

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Fill out an application online through a job portal, submit a resume, cover letter and list of references. Interview over the phone. Group interviews in person.  Received offer letter.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? What are you doing now? Why did you leave your last job? What can you bring to this position? What are some of your strengths?

title: Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: student job, asks basic questions- career goals, skills, walk through your resume, etc. Usually skills from your major are applicable to the position, technical questions as well, what you expect to learn from this position, what do you bring to the table that other applicant won't.
Interview Questions: What are you looking to gain from this position?

title: Administrative Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I graduated college on a thurday and i applied for this position on friday. got called in the afternoon to do an interview, went and did it, left and got called 5 mins later offering me the position. Many other places on campus take over 3-4 months to hire, this one was quick
Interview Questions: What experience I have

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied Tuesday morning and was emailed that afternoon to schedule an interview for the following Tuesday. I was offered the position the following day. During the interview I was not asked many questions and was not given a tour of the facilities, which initially worried me. I was introduced to the staff and had an opportunity to ask them a few questions. The interview lasted approximately 20 minutes. My references were called the day after the interview just before I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: had a skype interview with my advisor and two other members of the graduate admission committee for about 45 minutes. Answers general questions and talked a bit about my plan for my Ph.D. and why did I choose the University of Utah.
Interview Questions: Why am I passionate about astrobiology?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a 15 minute phone interview regarding experience and skills. Answered questions and gave details on experience with staff management, data reporting, public speaking skills, and creative abilities. Invited to ask my own questions regarding the position, and after careful review of their website, I had questions on their sponsor base, management team dynamics, and then we discussed the compensation scale.
Interview Questions: Pr Skills, data reporting skills

title: APC- Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: well planned, one candidate before a panel of 1 PA, 1 physician, and 1 practice manager.  Initially applied online, then contacted by practice manager for a phone screen/preliminary interview.  A follow up interview before a panel was scheduled the next week.
Interview Questions: What can you offer/bring the group?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was technical and not that difficult mostly focussed on SQL and previous work experience and also the empoyer ws keen to see how enthu i was about joining the team.
Interview Questions: Informatica mappings, power center details

title: Clinical Study Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was given a phone interview within 2 weeks of applying for the job, and then brought in for an interview with the clinical study coordinators and the doctor I would be working with. The in-person interview was only half an hour.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were confused about a task?

title: Business School Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions:
One 20 minute Skype interview that turned into an hour. The interviewer was pleasant and I felt a rapport and was surprised to get a call that I hadn't been chosen due to a "lack of leadership experience."

I felt grateful for the honest opinion, but it got ugly when I asked how I could have better explained my years of leadership experience in the military and as a business owner. The conversation turned into a lame defense of how many veterans the interviewer knows, followed by an attack that I don't really understand the current Utah economy.
Interview Questions: Explain the current Utah economic situation.

title: Data Analyst Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual. It was more like a discussion on my experience and the job position requirements. Also they explained the tools that they are using and they explained the process, audience and various other aspects of the organization.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience as a manager?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: 6 interviews in one day. That night they organize a dinner with poster session from current students. This is also important, as a lot of faculty and program directors may have an eye on you. The next day you are with senior PhD students for an activity.
Interview Questions: Previous research

title: Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process lasted about an hour. From first interview to actual hiring took approximately 6 weeks. As an internal transfer, the process was easy. All of my info was already within the system and transferred over easily.
Interview Questions: Why I'm interested in the position

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first is the phone interview. Then there is the first onsite interview. This interview is interviewed by the group. If you pass the first onsite interview, you will be invited to the second round interview. This time the partners will also interview you for the qualification. For all these interviews, the interviewers usually asked the behavior questions. In the second round interview, they also test you for some technique questions.
Interview Questions: How the team work means to you?

title: Conference Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied and then was contacted by email to schedule a phone interview with the department supervisor. Two days later was an in-person interview, followed by a second interview with the department manager.
Interview Questions: What is something that you have failed at? What did you learn from it?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: It was a typically behavioral-based interview, no hard questions. Questions were like tell me about yourself, what would be your tutoring strategy, why do you want to be a tutor, etc.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Psych Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had about 5 people interviewing me, manager of the unit, a couple RNs from the unit of interest and a couple psych techs from the unit. They went around asking questions and made it comfortable. The manager called me 30 mins later offering me the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation you had with a coworker in the past, and how you resolved that issue.

title: Behavioral Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied with excellent credentials and work history. After followup I got the email stating "look somewhere else." So I'm taking them up on it. No sense in waisting time.
Interview Questions: What did you do about stress?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the University's website and it took a total of 2 weeks which included a week to work on a design exercise. My first interview was with my potential supervisor and the marketing director. The second interview was with the rest of the marketing team, including my supervisor (3 people).
Interview Questions:
What is your process for graphic design?
We discussed some of the projects in my portfolio and my thought process.

Have you ever had a client not like a piece you've created that you loved?
We discussed my process for the design exercise.

title: Accounting Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I went to buy textbook for my class and my cashier was the Accountant supervisor for the Bookstore at the time. Then, we were chatting and I told her that I'm in the Accounting program. She told me that they have a position open online and asked me to apply for it. Therefore, I applied online and few days after, I got a phone call for interview. I went to the Bookstore for interview with the Accountant supervisors, then they told me to wait for a response from a phone call.
Interview Questions: Why you want to work here?

title: Training Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, 2-3 managers, possibly 1-2 co workers.  There was a brief introduction to the group.  I then gave my presentation, it was to be 15 minutes.  I was then asked many of the standard questions posed during an interview.  I also had a chance to ask questions to the group.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is based on previous courses you take or relevant experience in the subject applying for. Talking to  professors teaching the course directly helps rather than just applying online. Recommendation fro research professors or from whom you have taken the class is helpful.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: One initial phone interview.  Two and three panel interviews with 3 rounds.  First IT Directors.  Second entire IT team.  Third 3 major customers position will serve
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult situation and how you handled it.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: we had an appointment at 1 but she made a mistake. so there was two interviewee even though it was not the multi people interview. he asked general questions like what would you do in the particular situations. the interview was very easy. I had interview at the warehouse with two people. both were nice and questions were very easy to answer.
Interview Questions: general questions

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with the professor I would be TAing for. He just asked me why I wanted to be a TA. And asked me how I did in the class I would be TAing.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to be a TA?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: After I have received the work study grant, I applied through the University of Utah's career website for work study jobs specifically.  Afterwards, I received an interview through the specific department that I applied for.  When I went to interview, it was primarily focused upon whether I would be a good fit for the job or not.  Afterwards, I waited a couple of days and received an offer afterwards.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do you have with the tasks the job description has?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
People were required to submit their resume and the selected candidates were interviewed further.

The selected candidates were interview by two professors. They needed some with with computer organization background and someone with software practices background. People were required to know c and c++
Interview Questions: What is IEEE floating point representation

title: GIS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Did a phone and in-person interview.  Never heard from them again.  Had to call HR to ask about the position.  At least have the professional courtesy to follow-up with those you interview, even if it is to decline.
Interview Questions: What did I know about the university?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, I took some of the course in the past semesters. I had gathered some cleanroom experience. Then talked to the professor who was in charge of the TA assignments. He reviewed my resume and I got the job.
Interview Questions: Asked question about basic microfabrication processing

title: KC Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was super chill. They asked basic questions about you and what field you study in. They also asked if you have any computer skills and how comfortable you are with costumers.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have with technology?

title: Help Desk Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process with University of Utah was better than most, but made me realize the department I was joining lacked a good vetting process for new employees. I went through a brief series of phone calls and e-mails, followed by a short, in-person interview with department supervisors. The interview process felt very rushed overall due to an immediate need to fill a position, but was not unpleasant.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you didn't know how to solve a problem?

title: IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview, then I had an interview in person. The questions were very to the point, and they try to find ways to incorporate additional skills and knowledge you may possess, and ask you to relate those abilities to the job you are applying for, or how you feel better prepared as a result of them.
Interview Questions: I was asked to look at different prints of code samples, and to identify what they did.

title: Web Developer III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first two times we scheduled for the interview ended up being postponed. When the interview finally did happen, it started with one of the project's leaders, who was joined by the principal leader a short time later. This part of interview was friendly and conversational, I felt completely at ease. After about an hour, they brought in the two developers already on the project to check my technical skills. We did a few white board exercises and exchanged a few ideas on how to test a developer's skill. Following that, the project lead came back in and we continued the social fit portion of the interview. In the end, he asked me if I wanted the job and told me he'd hire me right there, but had to go through the proper channels. Two days later I got a call from the recruiter that sent me in with an offer that more than met my goals.
Interview Questions: Given a specified set of tables, write a SQL query to retrieve data from a RDBMS.

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT)
Interview Descriptions: I met the PI of the lab and discussed the research focus of the lab and potential projects. I then met with members of the lab to discuss their projects and then gave a 1 hour presentation of my graduate work.
Interview Questions:
What about this lab's research focus interests you?
Do you or will you have your own funding?
Would the "weird" reputation of Utah pose any issues for you?

title: Sales Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: They took a very long time to interview me and extend an offer letter. I was hired a total of 10 weeks after my first initial interview, with a two week break in between each of the following interviews (4). I met with everyone on the team, and the job they described in the interview process is much different than the one I'm performing on a daily basis.
Interview Questions:
Tell me something that isn't on your resume.

Why are you interested at working at the University of Utah?

How many hours a week are you accustomed to working?

What is something that people perceive of you, that isn't true?

title: Contractor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: We went over my CV, as well as several case scenarios that I may encounter in my position.  Additionally, we discussed my transcripts and reviewed the different classes I took while pursuing my advanced degrees.  There was not a lot of idle time during the interview, and I really got a sense of urgency in regards to the position - as well as the gravity associated with performing well for the University and also for those whom I would be serving.
Interview Questions: Q: Given the case we have outlined, how would you begin this project?

title: Software Design Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was mainly asked to explain the architecture of one of the Systems that I have built in my previous company. Also, I was asked with certain questions related to Spring and Hibernate in JAVA. Mostly, questions were focused on the previous projects.
Interview Questions:
How does Autowiring process occur in the Spring framework?
How a Many to Many Association is performed in Hibernate ? etc..

title: Executive Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2015

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah
Interview Descriptions: There are two ways to get your feet in the door. Either doing a detailed research and contacting faculty members prior to officially submitting your application For that here's my suggestion. 1) Do your homework ahead of time and make a thorough research on different programs, colleges at which you would like to pursue a degree 2) Once you can be more specific about what you want to do, what kind of research interests you figure out the best faculty members that fits the field you would like to do research in 3) Make sure you update your CV (must be detailed,  several pages for someone who has completed college, worked a job at least for a year or two) and look into sample cover letters to make sure to include why you are applying to specific program. It is crucial to link how your previous experience would make you a good fit to the program you are applying. Even if you don't have any experience in the field, be enthusiastic, original and show you know where the field is going, or at least show interest in doing research in the field (be sure to include reasons and justifications for that). It is not easy to write these letters so, that's why if you have any chance to attend conferences, workshops related to the field try to do that. At least use the internet effectively to get a better sense of why that field of research is important and how you see yourself contributing to the field once you are accepted to the program.
Interview Questions: I met my adviser at an international conference, and prior to attending the conference I already knew he was going to be there and I was well prepared to introduce myself, hand out my CV and tell him why I was interested in joining his research group. Since it was not a formal interview, he liked my proactive approach and things went well (simply because he had a project he needed to find a graduate student to work on)

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It took them 3 months after I applied for them to call me.  When they did I was asked to come in and take a test that included questions about SQL, Excel, and problem solving.  After taking the test it only took a couple of days fro them to call me for an interview.  The odd thing was that both times they called, for the test and the interview, they just had me write down the address and time and never sent me a confirmation email with all the details.  

The actual interview had the typical interview questions like "explain a time when you had to confront a colleague." It was a very standard interview and they seemed bored and uninterested to be there from the very beginning, even though I felt like I gave good answers and tried to liven it up a little.  There were two financial analysts and one person from HR in the interview.  They explained all of the job functions and so-called benefits of working for them.  The benefits really just included the same things that every other company has, namely a couple of weeks of PTO a year, 401k match, Health Insurance, and a few Holidays off.  Nothing spectacular.  They said that the next step would be to meet with their boss if he chose to and then they would make their decision.  It was about a week and a half later when I received an email indicating that they were not going to select me for the job.  

Overall I was unimpressed with the organization of the interview process and the company seemed very bureaucratic.
Interview Questions: If there are eight cubes that all look the same, but one of them is heavier than the others, can you figure out which one is the heavier one by only measuring twice using a balanced scale.

title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I’ll first start off by talking about the initial application submission. I wasn’t sure if the University of Utah used an automated filtering system/automatic data extraction function with their electronic applicants, and seeing as how I was using a PDF for my resume, I had to call the employment department just to make sure. They informed me that actual humans do review each application, so anyone who submits a PDF or other in-extractable document type need not worry about this. 

After submitting my application, it took about 1.5 weeks to first hear back from the hiring manager. She was very enthusiastic and requested that I submit a marketing proposal as part of the first round of interviews. I won’t get into the details of it, but she did provide some guidelines for what was to be included in the proposal. I was given about a week to complete the proposal and submit it back to her.

It took about another week or week and a half to hear back from her again. I was very excited to have been selected to meet with her and a few others in person as part of the second round of interviews. I assumed at this point that there were only less than a handful of candidates they were seriously considering, so I felt confident. However, the second round interview was frankly, grueling. I’m not sure if this is an institution-wide procedure, but I was required to do a 15-minute presentation to the team I would be working with, followed by half an hour of panel interviews (by the same team of people), followed by another 45-minute interview with just the hiring manager and the director, and finally, to wrap up the TWO HOUR ordeal, a 20-minute writing test, which was to write a short marketing piece on the spot. 

This was the first time in my career that I’d experienced an interview process such as this one. I understand that a top institution would want to hire the best of the best (well, what company wouldn’t), but is it really necessary to make the candidate do a presentation AND a panel interview? Definitely seemed a little too bureaucratic for my taste. Not to mention, I definitely felt that dialogue was not encouraged. It was simply answer-the-question-answer-the-question-answer-the-question. No time to really have a real, human discussion.

To satisfy the bonus points, I’ll give my two cents on the people and company culture. From what I picked up during the in-person interviews, the atmosphere definitely seemed a little more serious than what I’d imagined. One thing I emphasized several times throughout the interview, was that in my previous experience of being a student at the University of Utah, everyone I’d met who’d worked there seemed so happy and proud of what they did there. Ironically, the people interviewing me hardly seemed happy or proud at all. But maybe this was just a departmental issue. I can attest to this observation because during my presentation, I took a “joke break” and cracked a few jokes to lighten the mood a little, and I got a poor, disheartening response from the team. But the way I see it is, I probably wouldn’t have been a good fit there anyway if I wasn’t allowed to be myself. 

Oh, one last thing: I spent around a good 24 hours in total preparing for a job that I wouldn't even get in the end (from brainstorming for the marketing proposal and putting it together, to preparing for the interview, to spending two hours at the in-person interview). I won't say it was a monumental waste of time, but... well, you get it.
Interview Questions: What do you think are the top three barriers for non-traditional students or students of an ethnic minority to successfully attain a higher education?
