title: Academic Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the director and manager. An online application was due before. I was called for an interview about a week after I submitted the online application. After the interview it took about another week for them to get back to me with an offer. It took a few more days to get the paperwork finished.
Interview Questions: How well do you multitask?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: The advisor will email you first to schedule the time for interview. The interview will be done in phone or skype depend on the professor. The interview will go through the resume that I submitted first. After that, the professor will start to explain the topic and area of his or her lab. The professor will make you choose the area you are interested and go from there.
Interview Questions: What is the related experiment experience?

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Every thing was very simple and straight forward. I was referred by someone who use to work here back then and it was all a breeze. I interviewed on a Friday and surprisingly I had an offer on the following Tuesday (in spite of being an international candidate living in Salt Lake City for more than 2 years).
Interview Questions: Didn't find anything difficult

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is the typical one on one and group interview model. Typically, the group interview consists of administrative staff and members of the current research team. The initial interview is with the hiring manager and if selected for a second interview, one more "one-on-one" interview will take place with the Division Chief and then the group interview. At the end of the interview a short basic research test is given.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult personalities?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at University of Utah in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied through graduate school and found an academic adviser who was interested to hire me to work in his/her lab. Then I kept email communication with the Professor and he/she interviewed me on different topics. He/she assigned me tasks to make sure I qualify for the position.
Interview Questions: I was not able to perform as expected in one of my PI's project.

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Typical graduate school admissions process, which involved submitting transcripts, letters of recommendation, and research statement.  Then to seek a specific research assistantship with a faculty, there was some in person interview time and chance to ask for available funding.
Interview Questions: What sort of skill set you have, do you have programming experience, etc.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was through skype. I had a phone interview coupled with a skype interview. It was mostly general asking about my previous bachelors experience, and how that helped me to decide what I wanted to do next.
Interview Questions: About interests?

title: Software Design Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone call to screen. Then Skype interview with the team, then meet the team in person.  When meeting with the team, I had the opportunity to talk with each person individually to learn more about the different involved in the process.  After the interview I sent thank you emails to each team member and was soon offered the position.
Interview Questions: Gave a hypothetical question related to tables and how to query the data.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: One interview was conducted and a second interview about a week later. It was fairly normal and basic. Questions about yourself and you past experience and why you applied and why you would be a good fit for the University.
Interview Questions: Basic Questions, strengths & weaknesses, very basic interview.

title: Assistant Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Excel, normal interview of what would you do in this situation.  Everyone was very welcoming.  They did interview with two people yet it was not overbearing.  After the interview they were kind and told me they would let me know within a few days.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation.

title: Driver I Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The process of applying to the driver position was actually quite easy. I applied online, as the University has just adopted an "online only" hiring process. That only took me about 3 min to complete because once you have applied to one position, it saves the information so that you can blow through other applications.

It took about 3 weeks to get a call, and I was invited to an interview. It was the easiest interview that I have ever done. It took about 15 min, the manager outlined the work, which was actually driving a cart to pick up outdoor trash. I took it!
Interview Questions: This is more of a waste management job than a driving job, would you still be interested?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to attend an interview weekend along with other candidates. I had already been accepted to the program, but hadn't selected an advisor. I was allowed to request meetings with several potential advisors. I met with 5-6 professors in the department and was given tours of different lab spaces. My competency was somewhat tested, but mostly it seemed they were trying to sell me on the university. On the second day, some of the current students took us skiing at Snowbird.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about random variables.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: telephone interview. let me introduce myself, and asked me several questions related with my previous work and study, and also asked my future research interests. They also described their research and courses.
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Search the website, and find the professor who share the same research inetersts with you. Then, I email him direclty. Then, he replies and ask me to write up some documents, such as research interests, the future research plans, and the CV. Then, I got a skype interview opportunity to dicuss some details about my plan and expertise.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose our lab

title: Pharmacy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: I work with the "U" in the past and I have some Problems With My Back Ending on a surgery, back on December last year I am fully recovery now. I been trying to come back if is possible to my previous job in the inpatient site but I don't have any success I am willing to start from bases even with all experience that I have.
Interview Questions: where part of the field I like the best

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process of interviewing for a postdoctoral research (fellow) is to first get a phone interview. These are given to the top ~10 candidates. If the interviewer is still interested (usually the top ~4), he/she will fly the candidate out to the university to meet in person to have more time with individual. Research processes are shared to help both parties determine if the new position will be a good fit. Additional meetings with other professors are scheduled and a seminar on recent work is usually presented by the interviewee. After that, we wait until we hear back with a no or yes.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do if you come work here?

title: Lab Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Was referred by previous employer.
Interview Questions: What was it like to work with enother employee.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very straight forward. I simply submitted my resume online. I needed the recommendation of two teacher from high school (or professors at the University of Utah). After I submitted my resume, I received a call from the professor from the University of Utah. He asked me a few questions about my interests in his research and some of my coursework. Overall, it was a very simply and relaxed process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lab Technician I Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Talked with PI. Was a referal from previous lab.
Interview Questions: What was it like working with another lab tech?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initially submitted resume online.  I heard back from Idaho Technology within a couple of weeks of posting my resume. They did a screening interview very brief about 10 mins.  Later,  I was contacted by lab manager to have a sit down interview.  The interview consisted of technical questions and character questions.  I was contacted a week later for a group interview.   I meet the lab employees and was taken to lunch at an upscale restaurant downtown.  The atmosphere was relaxed and it was more casual conversation than interview questions.  I was contacted a week later with a rejection.
Interview Questions: Give an example when you had to reach a deadline and the circumstances were not ideal.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Utah in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: We came in on Thursday. A busy Friday talked with 5 or so professors. On Saturday, went to ski. Its great. Sat evening, its poster session. There were lots of poster presented by fellow graduate student. Its a great opportunity to learn what they doing.
Interview Questions: No questions asked. They just talk their way. You just sit there listening

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Interviewing at the University of Utah to join their Molecular Biology PhD program is a really great experience. They know they're competing with Harvard, Stanford, etc (much bigger and more well-known schools), so they try to compete by showing off the city and the outdoors opportunities, and also by showing off the wonderful faculty and students at the U. 

Every interview candidate has a chance to go skiing/snowboarding at Brighton and to meet with pretty much any faculty member they want to.
Interview Questions: Describe your desired research program.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: Wrote a letter to my PI with my CV. I was invited out for an interview, which involved a presentation of my research with detailed questions and answers followed by a discussion of potential projects with the PI and one on one meetings with other individuals in the lab.
Interview Questions: I presented my PhD research, and was grilled by the entire lab on my technical work.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: Hired because I knew the lab manager and had lab experience, was a telephone interview, went very smoothly.
Interview Questions: How long are you wiling to work here? This job requires 6 months of training  and you will only be hired if you can commit at least 2 years, I would prefer 5.

title: Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Dec 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was called on 1400 hrs I went sat in the interview room. Was asked basic questions in java. I answered all. But still dint get a call .

title: App Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: face to face interview was easy
Interview Questions: past experience

title: Graduate Student Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Utah in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Typical grad student interview, but they send acceptances the week following interviews, which is a great benefit.
Interview Questions: Why not another university?

title: Quality Assurance Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Verona, WI) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Turned in resume, and had a phone interview.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses?

title: Accounting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: Depends on the Department, usually a phone interview, then a interview or two.
Interview Questions: Depends on Interviewer - usual questions.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is similar to may graduate programs with the exception that the University of Utah offers several additional benefits, such as skiing, and hiking that are often used to help entice students to come.
Interview Questions: Didn't have one.

title: Executive Cabinet Member Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Utah (Salt Lake City, UT) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Sat in a circle with the elected executive officers.  Fairly easy.  Tag-teamed the questions.  Some of the questions were a bit subjective:  what does diversity mean to you.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress
